business.headline: US Fed chair signals possible September rate cut, cites rising job market risksUS Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's comments open the door to a rate cut at the Fed's September 16-17 meeting, but also put heavy weight on jobs and inflation reports that will be received before then.

Planning Europe trip? Schengen visa hike may upset your trip budgetThe Schengen visa allows travellers to visit 29 European countries for up to 90 days within a 180-day period. Applicants must submit standard documents, including travel plans, insurance, and financial proof.

Sebi strikes at finfluencer Avadhut Sathe's Karjat Trading AcademyThe action followed complaints that penny stocks were being promoted during his training sessions, allegedly presented as classroom examples while encouraging students to invest.

Which bank offers higher 1-year FD? See rates from HDFC, ICICI, SBI and 3 othersMost lenders usually announce similar interest rates on one-year deposits, making it seem as if there isn't much of a difference in where you invest. However, a closer look at the latest rates reveals small but meaningful variations.

Sensex closes 694 points lower, Nifty below 25,000; Asian Paints down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 694 points lower at 81.306.85 points, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 213.65 points to end at 24,870.10.

This investor cut his Rs 10 lakh tax bill to 0. Here's howMany taxpayers assume that once the financial year ends, their chance to save tax is gone.and Ramesh was no exception. But instead of rushing, he used a little-known route that brought his tax bill down to nothing.

Dalal Street gears up for busy week with 5 market debuts, 2 IPOs in pipelineMangal Electrical Industries is set to debut on August 28 after finalising its allotment on August 25. Patel Retail, Vikram Solar, Gem Aromatics, and Shreeji Shipping Global will all list on August 26.

Wealthy Asian families bet big on crypto: ReportThe growing interest comes as Bitcoin recently hit an all-time high of over $124,000. New rules, such as Hong Kong's stablecoin legislation and the United States' GENIUS Act, have further boosted confidence in the sector.

Real-money gaming ban rocks advertising, sports sponsorships: What's at stake?The rise of money-based platforms created billions in advertising spend, now facing a sudden halt. This article examines how the ban on real-money gaming is reshaping India's advertising, sports sponsorships, and emerging e-sports opportunities.

Credit score confusion: Is CIBIL transparent enough in deciding your financial fate?The credit score by CIBIL can decide whether someone gets a car loan, a home loan, or even a credit card. Yet, very few actually know how CIBIL works or who controls it.

ITR filing 2024–25: Comparing deductions under old and new tax regimeFiling your Income Tax Return for FY 2024–25? Before you decide on old or new tax regime, it's important to know how deductions differ. The right choice could help reduce your taxable income and overall tax burden.

Why middle class feels stuck between taxes and EMIs, explains CAThe burden is not just about taxes. Price hikes on fuel, food, education, and healthcare hit the middle class the hardest. Unlike the rich, they cannot hedge against inflation with high-value assets. Unlike the poor, they don't receive government relief.

entertainment.headline: Swara Bhasker clarifies Dimple Yadav crush remark: Focus on vote theftIn an exclsuive chat with India Today, actor Swara Bhasker has clarified her comment about having a girl crush on Samajwadi Party MP Dimple Yadav amid social media backlash. She urged people to concentrate on the vote theft row instead of trolling her.

A Big Bold Beautiful Journey Trailer: Margot Robbie, Colin Farrell in an epic voyageMargot Robbie and Colin Farrell star in the romantic fantasy A Big Bold Beautiful Journey. The film explores deep emotional themes and promises a magical cinematic experience.

Bigg Boss 19 house unveiled: A vibrant cabin in woods with assembly room and no jailThe newly designed house with wooden textures, vibrant colours and many new surprises was unveiled by Bigg Boss 19 makers. A glimpse at the new house ahead of the grand premiere.

Anurag Kashyap quits drinking, says leaving Mumbai cured his depressionDirector Anurag Kashyap has moved out of Mumbai, citing negativity in Bollywood. He recently opened up on how his shift to Malayalam cinema has revived his creativity and improved his mental health.

OTT releases this week: Films, series to watch on Prime Video, JioHotstar, NetflixFrom Kajol's 'Maa' to 'The Map That Leads To You' and 'Bigg Boss 19', here is everything that will be available for streaming this weekend on OTT. Have a look at the list of all the new films and series releasing across Prime Video, JioHotstar and Netflix.

Actor Raza Murad files police complaint over death hoax, calls it shamefulVeteran actor Raza Murad has filed a police complaint after false reports of his death circulated on social media. He expressed disappointment over the fake news and called it shameful.

Behind the camera, beyond the myth: Dilip Kumar's stormy storyAshok Chopra's The Man Who Became Cinema showcases Dilip Kumar the artist, not the whole man. In 480 pages dissecting 57 films, it reveals how India's first method actor transformed Hindi cinema, while leaving the off‑screen story largely untold.
Salman Khan begins shooting Bigg Boss 19 in Galwan look. First picsActor Salman Khan looked handsome as he joined 'Bigg Boss 19' during the premiere shoot. The first photos of the show are now out.

Anemone trailer: Daniel Day-Lewis returns after 7 years in son's family reunion filmActor Daniel Day-Lewis has ended his retirement with a new role in 'Anemone', directed by his son. The film is based on a reunion between two brothers who share a complex bond with each other.

Chiranjeevi at 70: A megastar who redefined Telugu cinemaMegastar Chiranjeevi turns 70, celebrating a career marked by constant reinvention and mass appeal. His journey spans blockbuster films, social themes, and a bold political stint, maintaining his iconic status.

Learnt from Mohanlal, time to unlearn a few things: Film body president Shwetha MenonShwetha Menon, who has been newly appointed as the president of AMMA, said she has begun the work to provide a makeover to the association. She said "it's time to unlearn a few things."

Bhagwant Mann mourns Jaswinder Bhalla's death: Chacha Chatra will live in our heartsPunjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann condoled the death of veteran actor-comedian Jaswinder Bhalla in an emotional note. The 'Carry on Jatta' actor died on August 22 at 65.

Bigg Boss 12 fame Saba Khan marries businessmen Waseem Nawab in Jodhpur. See PicsActor Saba Khan, who featured in 'Bigg Boss 12', got married to businessman Waseem Nawab in an intimate ceremony in Jodhpur. She shared a heartfelt note on social media along with her wedding pictures.

R Madhavan, wife celebrate son's 20th birthday, Rehna Hai co-star Dia sends wishesOn the occasion of their son Vedaant's birthday, actor R Madhavan's wife shared a series of throwback photos on social media. Several actors, including Dia Mirza and Ronit Roy, extended their wishes in the comment section of the post.

Sima Taparia rejects Nausheen Ali Sardar's matchmaking request over religionNausheen Ali Sardar revealed that matchmaker Sima Taparia refused to help her find a life partner due to her religion. The actor criticised Taparia's conservative views and questioned who defines the right match for her.

Jr NTR to reassess future choices after War 2's poor theatrical run | ExclusiveJr NTR is now rethinking his Bollywood journey following the underperformance of 'War 2'. The actor is now concentrating on Telugu cinema and a major pan-India project with director Prashanth Neel to strengthen his mass appeal.

Bigg Boss 19 official confirmed contestants list revealed. Find out moreBigg Boss 19 has officially commenced shooting with 17 diverse contestants including actors, singers, influencers and comedians, hosted by Salman Khan. The season promises exciting twists with special entries like Mike Tyson and a mix of familiar and fresh faces from India and abroad.

Did Krushna Abhishek and Kiku Sharda fight on Kapil Show? Viral video suggests soA viral video of comedians Krushna Abhishek and Kiku Sharda getting into a heated argument has shocked fans. Neither of the duo has issued any statemnet on the spat.

Apoorva Mukhija responds to her ex's viral song: Truth always comes outInfluencer Apoorva Mukhija has reacted to cheating allegations by her ex-boyfriend, Utsav Dahiya. She commented on a reel of an influencer, stating that the truth always comes out. Meanwhile, Dahiya alleged that attempts are being made to hack into his social media account.

general news.headline: 1 feared dead after cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Chamoli; shops, vehicles damagedA cloudburst in Chamoli's Tharali caused massive destruction, leaving one girl trapped and one person missing amid debris. Rescue teams and SDRF are carrying out relief operations as roads remain blocked.

Trump picks loyalist Sergio Gor as US ambassador to India, calls him great friendTrump appointed Sergio Gor, White House personnel director, as ambassador to India and special envoy for South and Central Asian affairs.

5 killed as tour bus crashes in New York, Indians among those on boardA tour bus from Niagara Falls to New York City crashed near Buffalo, killing five and injuring several others. Passengers were ejected; most were Indian, Chinese, and Filipino.

Trump's hardline push shrinks US immigrant count by 1.5 million, 1st since 1960sWith an ageing population, the impact of this decline is also being felt in US's labour market. According to the Pew Research Centre, the workforce has lost over 750,000 workers due to the reduction in immigrant numbers.

Meet Sergio Gor, Trump's new India envoy Elon Musk once called 'a snake'Sergio Gor is considered one of the most powerful behind-the-scenes figures in Trump's team and had reportedly played a key role in the fallout between Donald Trump and Elon Musk.

Getting Zelenskyy-Putin together like mixing oil and vinegar, says TrumpTrump compares arranging a Putin-Zelenskyy meeting to mixing "oil and vinegar," emphasising difficulties in brokering peace while warning of sanctions if Russia obstructs efforts to end the Ukraine war.
China's TikTok back in India? Government rejects social media reportsIn 2020, India had banned TikTok and 58 other Chinese-owned apps, citing data security concerns.

Rohit, Kohli not retiring soon, farewell talks premature: Rajeev ShuklaBCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla dismissed speculation over Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's futures, saying that retirement and farewell talks are premature at the moment. Kohli and Rohit have already retired from T20Is and Tests.

The lost art of handwriting: Why pen and paper terrify so manyHandwriting may seem like a harmless task, but for many, it triggers panic, pain, and deep-rooted memories of humiliation. In India, where exams and careers still demand pen-and-paper skills, this fear creates real barriers. As digital life takes over, handwriting anxiety reveals both a generational struggle and an urgent call for recognition and change.
Locked in school overnight, head stuck in window grille: Class 2 girl's ordealThe incident, according to sources, occurred on Thursday in a village located in the Odisha's Keonjhar district.

Relive the moment when Chandrayaan-3 landed India on the MoonOn August 23, 2023, the Indian Space Research Organisation's (Isro) Chandrayaan-3 mission successfully touched down near the lunar South Pole.

I never saw Trump behave inappropriately with anyone: Epstein associate MaxwellGhislane Maxwell told the Justice Department she never saw Donald Trump in any inappropriate setting. Her comments come amid scrutiny over the release of Epstein investigation files and her prison transfer.

A rotten meat scandal in Kashmir is seeing restaurants dish out rajma chawalOver 12,000 kg of rotten chicken and mutton have been seized and destroyed in Jammu and Kashmir since the first week of August. Hoteliers have started offering vegetarian dishes as customer footfall sees a dip. It has severely affected them as businesses were just about turning a leaf following a lull after the Pahalgam terror attack.

Had Kejriwal resigned...: Amit Shah on why bill to oust arrested leaders happenedFormer Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was arrested in 2024 in the alleged liquor scam case and refused to step down, drawing sharp criticism from the BJP for "running the government from jail".

Criminals and corrupt should be in jail, not in power: PM Modi at Bengal rallyPM Modi referred to Bengal Correctional Services Minister, Chandranath Sinha, who is in jail in connection with the teacher recruitment scam case.

From the India Today archives (2008) | Raj Thackeray and the politics of hateThe MNS chief, whose meeting with Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has caused a buzz, is known to play to the Maharashtrian gallery, but to what success?

Why the world is coming to India for surgeries and second chancesFrom complex cancer surgeries to joint replacements and rare orthopedic procedures, Indian hospitals are proving to be trusted destinations for global patients who have either lost hope or faced limited options at home.

Canada drops many retaliatory tariffs, seeks reset in trade talks with USCanada will drop many retaliatory tariffs to match US exemptions under the USMCA, retaining steel, aluminium, and auto tariffs. Carney calls it pragmatic; critics call it capitulation amid ongoing trade tensions.
Salman Khan begins shooting Bigg Boss 19 in Galwan look. First picsActor Salman Khan looked handsome as he joined 'Bigg Boss 19' during the premiere shoot. The first photos of the show are now out.

Confession: Defence Minister roasts Asim Munir over India Ferrari, Pak dumpster remarkRajnath Singh said Pakistan Army Chief General Asim Munir's recent comments comparing India and Pakistan's economic conditions amount to an admission of failure.

Serena Williams turns to GLP-1 drugs: Is it a new era in weight loss?For decades, fitness influencers and athletes swore by "clean eating" and intense workouts as the ultimate path to weight loss and peak performance. But Serena Williams's revelation signals a potential cultural shift - are we moving into an era where science, and not sweat alone, drives results?

FBI raids ex-Trump adviser John Bolton's home day after he slammed India tariffsThe raids come a day after John Bolton, in an interview, called Trump an 'aberrational president' while castigating him over his imposition of steep tariffs on India.

Tata EV 'in Summon Mode' knocks man down, CCTV captures fatal accidentTata Motors expressed condolences after a tragic accident in Tamil Nadu's Tiruppur district, where a man named Senthil reportedly died in a Tata Harrier EV mishap. The SUV, reportedly in Summon Mode, rolled back outside his shop, fatally striking him.

40% of chief ministers face criminal cases, 10 accused of serious offences: ReportThe Association for Democratic report analysed the self-sworn affidavits of all 30 sitting chief ministers from state Assemblies and Union Territories.

Swara Bhasker clarifies Dimple Yadav crush remark: Focus on vote theftIn an exclsuive chat with India Today, actor Swara Bhasker has clarified her comment about having a girl crush on Samajwadi Party MP Dimple Yadav amid social media backlash. She urged people to concentrate on the vote theft row instead of trolling her.

sports.headline: I am not giving it back: Trump's joke stumps FIFA president at White HouseUS President Donald Trump joked about keeping the FIFA World Cup trophy during a meeting with FIFA President Gianni Infantino. He refused to give the solid gold trophy back, cracking up the entire Oval Office.

After conquering grass, Iga Swiatek looks to crack the hardcourt codeIga Swiatek enters the 2025 US Open revived, having bounced back from a turbulent start to the season with a maiden Wimbledon crown and a dominant Cincinnati title. Back up to World No. 2, she now chases hardcourt glory in New York to reaffirm her all-surface dominance.

Rohit, Kohli not retiring soon, farewell talks premature: Rajeev ShuklaBCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla dismissed speculation over Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's futures, saying that retirement and farewell talks are premature at the moment. Kohli and Rohit have already retired from T20Is and Tests.

From Maaya Rajeshwaran to Kriish Tyagi: Junior India stars to watch out forUS Open 2025: Several junior Indian players, led by Maaya Rajeshwaran and Kriish Tyagi, will feature in the upcoming tournament. Four others—Hitesh Chauhan, Arjun Rathi, Rethin Pranav Senthil Kumar, and Arnav Paparkar—will play in the boys' qualifying rounds.
Krafton India to host two more official events in 2025Recent reports suggest Krafton India will host two more official events before the year ends.

BGMS Season 4 League Stage Week 1 Day 4 Results and Points TableBGMS 2025 Week 1 Day 4 saw Orangutan top the points table with 125 points, while Team Soul rose to 2nd with back-to-back wins. BGCS 2025 topped by Team Resilience on Day 3.

Hong Kong announce squad for Asia Cup 2025, Yasim Murtuza to leadHong Kong has announced a 20-member squad for the Asia Cup 2025, led by captain Yasim Murtaza and vice-captain Babar Hayat, combining experience and youth. The team will begin preparations in the UAE on August 24 ahead of Group B matches against Afghanistan, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka.

With more confidence, Pegula aims to shrug off 2024 heartbreakJessica Pegula enters the 2025 US Open with a mix of pressure and renewed confidence after a runner-up finish last year, despite recent early exits at the Citi Open, Wimbledon, National Bank Open, and Cincinnati.

Carlos Alcaraz put on notice as Kokkinakis reveals his 'only weakness'US Open 2025: Thanasi Kokkinakis opened up on the massive competition between Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz before the hard-court major gets underway on August 24 at Flushing Meadows.

AIFF, ISL organisers to start discussions over Master Rights Agreement termsAIFF confirmed it will enter negotiations with ISL organisers FSDL on the Master Rights Agreement to enable the 2025-26 season, as directed by the Supreme Court on Friday, August 22.

Elavenil Valarivan shoots India's second gold medal at Asian ChampionshipsIndian shooter Elavenil Valarivan secured gold in the women's 10m air rifle at Asian Championships. It was the second gold for India in the senior level in this edition of the tournament after Anantjeet Singh Naruka had claimed in men's skeet.

The team will begin preparations in the UAE on August 24 ahead of Group B matches against Afghanistan, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka.

It was the second gold for India in the senior level in this edition of the tournament after Anantjeet Singh Naruka had claimed in men's skeet.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
